title: Compared to sustained inflations for extremely premature infants, standard treatment prevails

title_detail.value: Compared to sustained inflations for extremely premature infants, standard treatment prevails

summary: Preterm infants must establish regular breathing patterns at delivery. For extremely preterm infants requiring resuscitation at birth, a ventilation strategy involving two sustained inflations, compared with standard intermittent positive pressure ventilation, did not reduce the risk of bronchopulmonary dysplasia or death at 36 weeks postmenstrual age.
